citation.excerpt: If you use this work please consider citing our [paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/1807.07464) as well as the original 2D RGB [paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/1502.03240).

description.excerpt: Implements Conditional Random Fields as Recurrent Neural Networks as in the repository from the original authors.

See the nested module permutohedral_lattice for more information on compilation for different image types. 
See Test for dummy example usages and the original repository to see how to integrate this with a neural network (logits come in this layer and logits come out (do not feed probability or labels as inputs)). 
The GPU kernel allocates a fixed size hash table which uses memory proportional to the square of the number of classes.
Conditional Random Fields as Recurrent Neural Networks (Tensorflow)

installation.excerpt:
To compile the code run: 
sh build.sh
